text:
There is also the
option to get the winre.wim from ISO patch it and do a "reagentc /setreimage".
Then there should be no need to resize afaik. We prefer disabling WinRE which
makes the vulnerability go away (what's not there can't be used). Much more easy
for us. To re enable it admin creds would be needed but then the machine is no
longer yours any way. Somehow I get the feeling that creating new moments (of
what the hell is going on) is much more in focus then getting things fixed the
right way. Markus Am 11/01/2024 um 19:19 schrieb Shawn K. Hall:
Link: None

metadata.subject: Re: [patchmanagement] You may hit a 0x80070643 - ERROR_INSTALL_FAILURE
metadata.email_text_original:
[You don't often get email from markus.klocker@univie.ac.at. Learn why this is
important at https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ] There is also the
option to get the winre.wim from ISO patch it and do a "reagentc /setreimage".
Then there should be no need to resize afaik. We prefer disabling WinRE which
makes the vulnerability go away (what's not there can't be used). Much more easy
for us. To re enable it admin creds would be needed but then the machine is no
longer yours any way. Somehow I get the feeling that creating new moments (of
what the hell is going on) is much more in focus then getting things fixed the
right way. Markus Am 11/01/2024 um 19:19 schrieb Shawn K. Hall:
Link: None
metadata.evaluated_keywords: ['create new moment', 'prefer disable winre', 'vulnerability go away', 'get thing fix']
